column1: 26839174_22,s0,T6,T7,"Finally, to determine whether the observed increase in mitochondrial function also affects cellular fitness, we studied the growth rates and RLS of ",mmr1Delta, ,mfb1Delta, cells.,Not_a_complex
26839174_22,s4,T8,T9,We find that there is no short-lived population of ,mfb1Delta, ,mmr1Delta, cells.,Not_a_complex
26839174_22,s6,T2,T11,"Thus, deletion of ",MFB1, extends RLS in ,mmr1Delta, cells and vice versa.,Not_a_complex
26839174_22,s7,T3,T12,Deletion of ,MMR1, in ,mfb1Delta, cells also rescued cellular growth rates (Fig. 4f).,Not_a_complex

26839174_22,s8,T4,T13,"Overall, these results indicate that ",Mfb1p," and Mmr1p have antagonistic effects in controlling mitochondrial partitioning, and that the disproportionate loss of mitochondria from mother cells is the primary cause for cellular growth defects and premature ageing in ",mfb1Delta," cells.
